text.section: Within thirty (30) days of the filing of an appeal, the commissioner shall hold an administrative hearing to be conducted in accordance with KRS 304.2-310. Whenever the commissioner determines that a fire protection classification is unreasonable, he or she shall by final order prescribe a reasonable classification to be followed for a period not to exceed one (1) year. A subsequent evaluation by the advisory organization or insurer shall not be permitted until the expiration of the period set by the commissioner.

The commissioner may compel obedience to its final orders by proper proceedings in the Franklin Circuit Court or any other court of competent jurisdiction, and these proceedings shall have priority over all pending cases.
